comments.html: Maybe the worst the decision was to allocate public IPv4 address space while already being aware of IPv4 address depletion. Now leaving the whole world with a readdressing (and IPv4-to-IPv6-conversion) or dual stack challenge for ever. This never ending challenge also costs a lot. I don't know if you can compensate that cost with cheap shared medium solutions. From a network perspective I prefer routing (small layer 2 domains) over bridging/switching/Ethernet/STP (large layer 2 domains). Whether it's CLNP or IPv6 is a matter of taste (or it depends which camp you belong).
comments.name: Anonymous
